us.ihmc.euclid.referenceFrame.interfaces

Interface FramePose2DReadOnly

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Pose2DReadOnly, ReferenceFrameHolder
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    FixedFramePose2DBasics, FramePose2DBasics
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FramePose2D

    public interface FramePose2DReadOnly
extends Pose2DReadOnly, ReferenceFrameHolder
    Read-only interface for a 2D pose expressed in a given reference frame.

    In addition to representing a Pose2DReadOnly, a ReferenceFrame is associated to a FramePose2DReadOnly. This allows, for instance, to enforce, at runtime, that operations on poses occur in the same coordinate system.

    Because a FramePose2DReadOnly extends Pose2DReadOnly, it is compatible with methods only requiring Pose2DReadOnly. However, these methods do NOT assert that the operation occur in the proper coordinate system. Use this feature carefully and always prefer using methods requiring FramePose2DReadOnly.

        default double getPositionDistance(FramePose2DReadOnly other)
        Computes the distances between the position part of the two poses.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the distance between the position part of the two poses.
        Throws:

      • epsilonEquals

        default boolean epsilonEquals(FramePose2DReadOnly other,
                              double epsilon)
        Tests if this pose is equal to the given other to an epsilon.

        If the two poses have different frames, this method returns false.

        Parameters:
        other - the other pose to compare against this. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance to use when comparing..
        Returns:
        true if the two poses are equal and are expressed in the same reference frame, false otherwise.

      • geometricallyEquals

        default boolean geometricallyEquals(FramePose2DReadOnly other,
                                    double epsilon)
        Compares this to other to determine if the two poses are geometrically similar.

        Two poses are geometrically equal if both their position and orientation are geometrically equal.

        Parameters:
        other - the pose to compare to. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance of the comparison.
        Returns:
        true if the two poses represent the same geometry, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        ReferenceFrameMismatchException - if other is not expressed in the same reference frame as this.

      • equals

        default boolean equals(FramePose2DReadOnly other)
        Tests if this pose is exactly equal to other.

        If the two poses have different frames, this method returns false.

        Parameters:
        other - the other pose to compare against this. Not modified.
        Returns:
        true if the two poses are exactly equal and are expressed in the same reference frame, false otherwise.
